page.title: 17BUDOCK'S ANNUAL EVENTS
page.content: Once a year, usually in July, the village of Budock has a carnival procession.The entries meet in the field next to the church where they are divided into categories and judged.After judging the procession moves through the village and turns around at the Manderley Hotel.It returns to the village playing field where prizes are presented and a barbeque is held {Budock Feast Day }is a revived custom held on the 19th of November. For the last few years the Womens' Institute has made itself responsible for arranging a communal supper and entertainment in the village hall. A garden show is held each summer in the village hall where local produce is judged.
